item.description:
We'll enjoy the gorgeous coast and some of Rye's back roads on this trip, passing a beautiful botanical garden, an expansive golf course, and some amazing houses, including the home of at least one international celebrity and a couple of local ones.

 This is an easy, flat route,  breezy and  shaded for most of its length.  Begin on Route 1A at the first  free parking area 1/4mi. south of the Seacoast Science Center.

We'll ride along the coast with stunning views of the ocean for 8 miles south to North Hampton.  After a stop we'll wind our way along the beach and some of the quiet back roads of Rye north to our starting point for a total of around 18-20 miles.

 (You can of course go farther or turn back sooner if you want a longer or shorter ride.)

All types of bicycles and riders are welcome.  Figure on about 3+ hours with stops.   Please wear a helmet.

And afterward there's food and drink at a local restaurant with a view!  

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing as I have no special training. As a participant, you agree to stay with the group or inform the organizer directly if you plan to leave early or to go off on your own.  -Larry Pilla
item.name: Rye Beach & Back Roads by Bike!
